Package com.server.pak

Class ServerApp

java.lang.Object
com.server.pak.ServerApp
public class ServerApp extends Object
Server startup class, the messaging transport system is based on the exchange of objects between the client and the server, serialization and deserialization of message objects is used. (Java IO). The server uses in its work: The User Authorization Service, the Listener of the connected client.
See Also:
AuthService, ClientHandler

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ServerApp()
    The constructor creates objects: AuthService, ExecutorService, ServerSocket and starts an internal loop waiting for a client connection in the - ServerSocket.accept() method.

  • Constructor Details

    • ServerApp

      ServerApp()
      The constructor creates objects: AuthService, ExecutorService, ServerSocket and starts an internal loop waiting for a client connection in the - ServerSocket.accept() method. Upon successful connection, a new thread is allocated for the client via ExecutorService and a ClientHandler listener is created.
      See Also:
      AuthService, ExecutorService, ServerSocket, ClientHandler

  • Method Details

    • getClientsList

      public String[] getClientsList()
      Returns a list of server client names.
      Returns:
      Array of strings with client names.

    • getClient

      public ClientHandler getClient​(String name)
      Returns the listener of the client by its name.
      Parameters:
      name - The client's name.
      Returns:
      The client's listener.

    • sendAll

      public void sendAll​(Message message)
      Sends a message to all clients of the server.
      Parameters:
      message - The message object.
      See Also:
      Message

    • isNickBusy

      public boolean isNickBusy​(String nickName)
      Checks whether the user's nickname is busy on the server.
      Parameters:
      nickName - User's nickname.
      Returns:
      The answer is whether the user's nickname is busy.

    • subscribe

      public void subscribe​(ClientHandler o)
      Signs a new client listener to the list of server listeners.
      Parameters:
      o - The client's listener.
      See Also:
